description: Change of use of a vacant office building to a hotel with one lightwell, landscaping and ancillary facilities.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [HUDU rapid health impact assessment, land contamination document, FA-PR-03, FAPR-04, FA-PR-05, FA-PR-06, FA-PR-07, FA-PR-08, FA-PR-10, FA-PR-11, Flood risk 
assessment and Design and access statement Received on 4 January 2023; FA-PR15 REV A, FA-PR-02C REV A and FA-PR-12C REV A Received on 22 March 2023; 
Construction traffic management plan REV A, Air quality assessment and Transport 
statement REV A Received on 11 May 2023; Noise impact report REV A Received on 
17 May 2023; FA-PR-01D REV B Received on 18 May 2023; Sequential test and 
impact assessment Received on 24 May 2023
Fire statement Received: 22 August 2023].

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until the following details have been submitted to 
and approved in writing by the local planning authority:
(a) A plan showing the position of each tree on the site and on land adjacent to 
the site (including street trees) that could influence or be affected by the 
development;
(b) Details of any proposed alterations to existing ground levels, and of the 
position of any proposed excavation, that may affect the root protection area 
of retained trees;
(c) Details of the fencing to be installed for the protection of retained trees.
The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the 
approved details, which shall be put into effect at the commencement of work on site 
and retained permanently for the duration of the development works.

Condition : 4 - The development shall not be occupied until a finalised Energy Strategy (demonstrating how the targets for carbon dioxide emissions reduction are to be met in line with the Mayor's energy hierarchy, and where necessary, a scheme of how any necessary contributions to the Council's Carbon Offset Fund are to be made) and in line with the information provided in the design and access statement has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Thereafter the development shall not be occupied until the measures set out in the approved Energy Strategy have been implemented in full and thereafter retained as such.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, prior to first occupation of 
the hereby approved development, details of the roof solar panels and a detailed 
roof layout demonstrating that the roof?s potential for solar photovoltaic installation 
has been maximised in a subservient manner shall be submitted to and approved in 
writing by the Local Planning Authority and thereafter implemented as approved and 
brought into operation before first occupation.

Condition : 6 - (a) No development shall take place until a BREEAM preliminary-assessment 
estimator (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) has been submitted to and 
approved in writing by the local planning authority demonstrating how an ?Excellent? 
(minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved, or if ?Excellent? cannot be achieved, 
the reasons why. 
(b) Within three months of work starting on site, a BREEAM Design Stage certificate 
and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be 
submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to show that the 
BREEAM rating agreed under (a) above will be achieved.
(c) Before the building(s) hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a 
BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such 
equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing 
by the local planning authority to show that the BREEAM rating agreed under Part 
(a) of this condition has been achieved.

Condition : 7 - The development hereby approved shall not be used for purposes other than a hotel 
(Use Class C1) of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as 
amended) or such other legislation as may subsequently supersede it.

Condition : 9 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a 
Travel Plan in accordance with current Council and TfL guidance comprising 
immediate, continuing and long-term measures to promote and encourage a 
reduction in car use shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local 
Planning Authority. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented upon 
occupation, and thereafter monitored and reviewed in accordance with the agreed 
Travel Plan targets and timescales to the satisfaction of the Local Planning 
Authority.

Condition : 10 - Notwithstanding the submitted details and prior to occupation, full details (including 
manufacturer?s specifications) of all cycle stands for the occupants of, and visitors to, 
the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning 
Authority.
The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before 
any part of the development is first occupied and thereafter retained for use at all 
times without obstruction.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development the waste and 
recycling stores shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the 
approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the 
duration of the development.

Condition : 12 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Car 
Parking Management Plan, to include full details of Blue Badge bays and EVCPs 
shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the 
approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless 
the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to secure any 
variation.

Condition : 13 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a 
Delivery & Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress 
arrangements and times that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and 
approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with 
current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to 
ensure sufficient arrangements (physical as well as managerial) for the servicing, 
including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for 
deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation. The development 
shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and 
shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written 
approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.

Condition : 14 - The cumulative noise from any fixed external plant associated with the scheme 
should not exceed levels more than 10 dB below representative background (LA90) 
levels at free field locations representing facades of nearby existing and proposed 
dwellings. Noise levels should be assessed by measurement or calculation based 
on the guidance presented within BS4142: 2014+A1:2019 or subsequent versions of 
this guidance

Condition : 15 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use a 
coach management plan (including details such as commitment to enter and exit the 
site as shown on the approved documents, a commitment to not stop on the public 
highway or any other location to drop off or pick up passenger and the document shall 
also include a commitment for a traffic marshal to assist coaches to enter and exit the 
site). The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with 
the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, 
unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any 
variation.

Condition : 16 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a 
visibility splay of 2.4 metres x 2.4 metres shall be provided on each side of the 
vehicular access (the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths 
outwards from the edges of the access). Thereafter, no fence, wall or other 
obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6 metres in height above the surface of the 
adjoining highway shall be erected, planted or allowed to grow within the areas of 
such splays.

Condition : 17 - No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until details regarding the sustainable drainage of the scheme has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local 
Plan Authority. The details as approved shall be implemented in full prior to occupation 
and maintained as such for the duration of the development.

Condition : 18 - Before the use hereby permitted first commences, any external ventilation equipment, 
including ducting and sound attenuation measures, together with any equipment to 
control the emission of fumes and odours from the premises, shall be installed in 
accordance with a scheme to be first submitted to and approved in writing by the Local 
Planning Authority. All equipment installed as part of the approved scheme shall be 
operated and maintained in accordance with the approved details and retained as 
such thereafter.
